author: TheBrickDudeStudios
title: Good set.
review:
Minifigs

This set only has one minifig and it is the surfer guy. He can either drive the beach buggy or ride on the surf board. This minifig has good surfer hair, A face with only one expression witch I do not like. I think this minifig has a lew print for his body, but I do not know, he also has sand blue legs.

Build

The build on this set is pretty simple, but I like it. The beach buggy has red wheels and I think that is cool. On the back of the buggy you can attach the surf board. You can put the minifig in the seat and make him drive it.

My opinion

This is a nice promotional set. If you cold not get it for free you can still get it for cheap. I recommend this set.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Small Beach Excursion
review:
Set #30369 Beach Buggy: Unlike most of the Polybags so far, this LEGO City 2020 Polybag doesn’t have a history, it’s the first offering of a Beach Buggy vehicle with a regular surfing citizen. It was offered as a GWP this summer from LEGO Shop & Home and so chances are you’ll have multiples of it.

Pros:

  • Very nice looking model with a simple and quick build.
  • Decent Minifigure with classic LEGO City design.
  • Light Blue Surfboard unprinted.

Cons:

  • Nothing to report.

Overall opinion

This is a great looking Polybag and a solid offering from LEGO City this year. I Highly Recommend this set and chances are you’ll find it easily at retail.
